summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and investigators working on the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail multiple trips planned for 2019 to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles, CA and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, FL, highlighting the ongoing investigative activity.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: SDNY legal assistant handling travel authorization logistics and per diem calculations for the investigative team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: SDNY staff member copied on travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: SDNY supervisor who approves travel requests for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: SDNY staff member copied on one travel approval email.

connections.description: Tyrrell approves travel requests that Alleyne processes and submits for the investigative team.
Both are SDNY staff members coordinating on travel logistics for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: SDNY investigative team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: SDNY investigative team requests travel to Los Angeles for an interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Planned Interview Trip to West Palm Beach
events.description: SDNY prosecutors request travel to West Palm Beach, FL for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, including reserving a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: SDNY team requests travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview related to the Epstein investigation, including reserving a hotel conference room.

events.title: Planned Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: SDNY team requests travel to West Palm Beach, FL for meetings and victim interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request for SDNY prosecutors to travel to West Palm Beach, FL for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Epstein Investigation
events.description: SDNY prosecutors formally request travel permission for the Epstein case (2018R01618) to conduct meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, FL.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Multiple travel requests in 2019 show active victim interviewing and investigative work by the SDNY in Los Angeles and Florida.
The emails indicate a pattern of securing hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews during these trips.
The correspondence reveals internal bureaucratic processes (per diem rates, travel authorization amendments) within the U.S. Attorney's Office related to the investigation.
Several sender/recipient email addresses are redacted, suggesting the involvement of additional prosecutors or investigators whose names are not disclosed.
